author: Ron Kohavi
title: A Study of Cross-Validation and Bootstrap for Accuracy Estimation and Model Selection
window: ` is defined as the expected value minus the estimated value. An unbiased estimation method is a method that has zero bias. Figure 1 shows the bias and variance of k-fold cross-validation on several datasets (the breast cancer dataset is not shown).
